description:
OpenStack Nova shows everything is OK when I boot an instance from an .vmdk image. Unfortunately, when I log on the ESX 5.1 host with vSphere client and check the terminal for this instance, it shows "Operating System not found". This is a similar issue as it is described in this link https://answers.launchpad.net/nova/+question/226853

The nova-compute node and the ESX 5.1 host are in the same LAN. I have tried both FlatManager and FlatDHCPManager as the network manager, but neither works.
title: VMware: unable to boot an instance from .vmdk on ESX 5.1 host

comments.content:
Hi Gary. 
I have tried the image you provided to me. It took such a long time to boot and the status of the instance was stuck in "spawning". Normally how long does it take for you to boot the instance? How do you allocate the nova-compute and ESX host? Do you install them on the same physical machine? For my configuration,  nova-compute and ESX host are not on the same macine but in the same LAN. I look forward to your reply.
Thank you very much.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~houshengbo

comments.content:
Hi Vincent,

The first time you boot a VM from an image, it needs to be copied from glance over to your vCenter datastore.  This can take a long time, especially if you have a slow network connection between glance + your vcenter.  

All future VM boots using the same glance image is much faster, as the image is already copied to the datastore.  

The root cause of your original "operating system not found" error is likely that you are using the wrong vmware_adaptertype metadata when creating the image.  See the instructions for "Images for VMware vsphere" section of http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/vmware.html
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danwent

comments.content: I changed the image into http://partnerweb.vmware.com/programs/vmdkimage/trend-tinyvm1-flat.vmdk and it works. I uploade the image with the command "glance image-create --name trend-thin --is-public=True --container-format=bare --disk-format=vmdk --property vmware_disktype="thin" --property vmware_adaptertype="ide" < trend-tinyvm1-flat.vmdk".
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~houshengbo
